results.title: Death warmed up
results.creator_credit: Tucker Production Company, Murray Newey and David Blyth
results.brief_description: Michael Tucker (Michael Hurst) is programmed to kill his parents by genetic surgeon, Dr Archer Howell (Gary Day) and is incarcerated in a psychiatric institution for the crime. Years later, Michael and friends travel to an isolated Island where Howell now runs Transcranial Applications, experimenting on humans and turning them into mutant killing machines. Michael seeks revenge on Howell for the death of his parents but also to stop him for the sake of mankind. Co-starring Margaret Umbers, William Upjohn, Norelle Scott, Bruno Lawrence and David Letch.

results.title: Death in Venice
results.brief_description: Gustav Aschenbach (Dirk Bogarde) is a distinguished man, a world-famous conductor who embodies all the civilised virtues of the European culture he represents. Yet on a solitary holiday in Venice, he spies an innocent boy - and abandons himself to a secret passion that carries him to his doom. Lyrical, intelligent and heartbreakingly beautiful “Death in Venice” accompanied by the haunting music of Gustav Mahler, will leave its echo in your memory for years to come. Based on Thomas Mann’s classic novel ‘Death in Venice’, Visconti’s film was voted Grand Prix winner at the 1971 Cannes Film Festival. Also stars Marc Burns, Bjorn Andresen and Silvana Mangano.

results.title: Death in Brunswick (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Meridian Films, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Film Victoria, Timothy White and John Ruane
results.brief_description: Carl Fitzgerald (Sam Neill) is the hard-luck hero in this pleasant little black comedy set in the Melbourne suburb of Brunswick. Carl lands a chef’s job in the cockroach infested kitchen of a dodgy nightclub. He meets a luscious young barmaid (Zoe Carides) who has the hots for him, but as luck would have it, the rocky romance is headed for trouble when an unfortunate incident at the club embroils Carl in a complicated mess. He enlists the help of his mate Dave (John Clarke)…things can only get worse from here on.

results.title: Death and the maiden
results.creator_credit: Behind the Scenes, Thom Mount, Josh Kramer and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: What if you had the chance to seek revenge for the crimes committed against you? Paulina Escobar (Sigourney Weaver), is faced with this moral dilemma when she confronts who she believes was her tormentor; a sadistic doctor who subjected her to physical, sexual and mental abuse 15 years ago when she was held hostage by South American Government interrogators. Paulina leads a quiet and nervous lifestyle with her husband (Stuart Wilson). This shaky semblance of peace is disrupted when her husband is brought home by a good Samaritan (Ben Kingsley) when his car breaks down during a storm. Alarm bells ring when Paulina recognises the voice from her blindfolded ordeal. Her husband is not convinced he is the offender and as a lawyer is challenged by her to present a case against the conviction.

results.title: Dear diary = Caro diario
results.creator_credit: Sacher Film, Banfilm, La Sept Cinema, Studio Canal, Nanni Moretti and Nella Banfi
results.brief_description: Moretti’s intimate and hilarious film diary, which follows the idiosyncratic Italian director’s personal experiences over 18 months, was received rapturously at Cannes where it won the Best Director Award. The film is divided into three chapters: in the first, we follow Moretti on his Vespa through the streets of Rome; in the second, he escapes with a friend to the beautiful Eolian islands; and in the third we see his dealings with conventional and alternative doctors. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Dead reckoning
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Sidney Biddell and John Cromwell
results.brief_description: Humphrey Bogart is at his best as a hard-boiled sleuth in this ‘40s film noir classic. He plays Rip Murdock, an ex-GI trying to discover who framed his pal, Johnny, for murder and then rubbed him out. Tracing his war buddy’s shadowy past leads Rip to Coral Chandler (Lizabeth Scott), who was once Johnny’s sweetheart and is now a chanteuse in a nightclub run by a brutal gangster, Martinelli (Morris Carnovsky). Rip gets a taste of the beautiful blonde’s seductive charms and soon finds himself ensnared in a twisted web of deceit and danger.

results.title: Dead Poets Society (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Steven Haft, Paul Junger Witt, Tony Thomas and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: When charismatic English professor John Keating (Robin Williams) arrives at a strict boys academy, his unconventional teaching methods breathe new life into the curriculum steeped in tradition. With his wit and wisdom, Keating inspires his students to pursue individual passions and make their lives extraordinary. (Awards: Academy Award winner for Best Original Screenplay)

results.title: Dead or alive 2: Birds [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Toei Video, Excellent Film, Yoshihiro Masuda, Makoto Okada and Takashi Miike
results.brief_description: This film is an unusual sequel to “Dead or Alive”; unusual in that is has the same two lead actors but virtually nothing else in common with the original in terms of plot. In this instalment (one of three) Sho Aikawa plays Mizuki Okamoto, a hit man hired to execute a member of the Yakuza. But instead the opportunity is missed when a mysterious man beats him to it. Fearing retribution Okamoto flees to the small island of his youth, only to be met by the same assassin whom he discovers is an old friend. Together, the two of them join forces using the proceeds from hits to buy vaccines for Third World children. Despite this set-up, Miike has very little use for the conventions of narrative, preferring to engage in the violent, kinetic excesses that are his signature, not to mention the dabbling in surrealist motifs, flashbacks and asides that often baffle. An intriguing mix of humour and action with redemptive overtones. Cast includes Show Aikawa, Riki Takeuchi, Endo Kenichi, Shinya Tsukamoto and Edison Chen.

results.title: Dead men don't wear plaid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Aspen Film Society, William McEuen, David V. Picker and Carl Reiner
results.brief_description: Steve Martin is Rigby Reardon, the best private eye of all time. Juliet Forrest (Rachel Ward) comes to his office with a case. Her father, a noted scientist, philanthropist and cheesemaker has mysteriously died. A complex trail of clues leads Reardon to “Carlotta’s lists”. Reiner has captured the essence of 1940’s detective films and presents an exciting but “fun” film. Reardon’s special “friends” include Alan Ladd, Barbara Stanwyck, Ray Milland, Burt Lancaster, Humphrey Bogart and Charles Laughton.
